title: The Godmother of AI on jobs, robots & why world models are next | Dr. Fei-Fei Li
themes: AI's impact on humanity and jobs
key_insights: AI was considered a 'dirty word' by tech companies as late as 2016, showing how rapidly perceptions can change
The combination of big data (ImageNet), neural networks, and GPUs created the foundation for modern AI
World models represent the next frontier in AI by enabling spatial intelligence and 3D world understanding
Robots need to understand 3D actions in 3D worlds, making them fundamentally different from language models
Being intellectually fearless and focusing on mission over every job dimension is crucial for career impact
AI development should prioritize human dignity and agency rather than just productivity gains
The 'bitter lesson' of AI (simple models with more data beat complex models) may not fully apply to robotics
Every person, regardless of profession, has a role to play in AI's development and governance

guest_background.current_role: Co-founder and CEO of World Labs, Co-director of Stanford HAI

topics_discussed: History of AI from the 1950s to present
Creation and impact of ImageNet dataset
The AI winter and subsequent revival
Launch of Marble product and World Labs
Applications in VFX, gaming, and simulation
The future of embodied AI and robotics
memorable_quotes: There's nothing artificial about AI. It's inspired by people, it's created by people, and most importantly, it impacts people.
We operate on about 20 watts. That's dimmer than any light bulb in the room I'm in right now. And yet we can do so much.
No technology should take away human dignity and the human dignity and agency should be at the heart of the development, the deployment, as well as the governance of every technology.
frameworks_mentioned: The bitter lesson (simple models with more data beat complex models)
Three pillars of modern AI: big data, neural networks, and GPUs
Spatial intelligence as complement to language models
recommended_for: Anyone interested in AI's societal impact
summary: Dr. Fei-Fei Li, known as the 'godmother of AI,' shares the untold history of how ImageNet sparked the AI revolution and discusses her new frontier work in world models and spatial intelligence. She emphasizes the importance of human-centered AI development and provides career advice for technologists while showcasing World Labs' groundbreaking Marble product.
